comment: She gives a lot of work with multiple assignments due in a week on different days. She does allow late work on some assignments, with minimal points off, but not after a certain point.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Noelle Brown is such a great professor. Only one assignment per week and you can choose which part of the module you want to write about in the assignment. Assignments are discussion boards with no specific word count, overall great professor, would recommend.

World Languages and Cultures
Only touched on one language the entire semester. 
About five or six assignments due each week.
It was very culture and gender heavy.
There are discussions every week, but you don't have to respond to people.
You don't need to buy the textbook. She takes pictures of the textbook or scans them and they are hard to read.

Dr. Brown was a good French professor, but I found this class tedious and hard to keep up with. There is constant homework, and the lectures aren't teaching the material directly so much as reviewing what you essentially taught yourself through the HW before class. I was frustrated by the volume of work and style of the lectures, but it was fine.

If you have never taken French in your life this class isn't for you. This class goes straight into advanced French even though it is an elementary French class. The textbook was like $160. Assignments were so difficult! Professor calls you out in class even if you don't volunteer to answer, so you are done for if you zone out for half a second.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Firstly, the expensive textbook is mandatory; and you must pay for it out of pocket since it won't apply to your school account. Secondly, it is a lot of homework; so I wouldn't recommend taking this if your other classes are very demanding as well. Overall, this class wasn't hard, as long as you apply yourself.

Noelle is a fairly easy grader who appreciates creativity - put a little effort into your papers and you'll do well. She's a very nice person in general, too. Missed class several times over my semester but we weren't impacted.
Very expensive textbook with homework software is absolute garbage and she seems to know it.
Would definitely take again!

Professor Brown is great! She gives a good bit of homework each week, but repetition and practice is important when learning a language. She cares about her students and is always willing to help you if you don't understand. She gives good feedback and I have genuinely learned so much from her class. I would absolutely recommend taking her!

Prof. Brown assigns a lot of HW but that's because this is a language class and you won't learn unless you practice. She's very passionate about French and she also grew up bilingual (French and English) so she's able to anticipate your areas of struggle. She will always guide you to success as long as you show interest and commitment.

You HAVE to take professor Brown! She is the best professor that I've had. She truly cares about her students and wants them to succeed. It is true that she assigns a lot of homework, but in return, she doesn't have any quizzes or tests. As long as you participate and apply yourself, you will have no problems in this class, and will even enjoy it!

So- shes nice enough as a person, I wont deny that. However the homework? Hell. You need the very expensive textbook for online work, and the activities are insane. 10+ questions each, with over 10 sections, so like 1 a b c etc. These are WEEKLY, on top of other stuff. shes so nice- but def a prof that thinks her class is the only one you have.

Dr. Brown is a shining example of who should be teaching! She is passionate about the topic, has organized the course in a clear manner, and cares a lot about her students. I wish I could take Dr. Brown for every class! She is easy to approach with questions and is incredibly encouraging. Her assignments prepared me well for the next course.

I think the main thing to keep in mind about taking a foreign language course is that practice and repetition are vital. Thus, while we did have a lot of homework and assignments, these were to help familiarize us. We were not graded harshly at all on how well we did them; she just wanted us to continue practicing.

She's awesome! Not everyone in the class had previous experience with French and she always tried her best to help our as much as she could. She responds very quickly to emails and (before Corona took over) was available for meetings. She's understanding and explains the subject well. I'll be trying to take more classes with her when I can!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Bro you have to do so much. work in this class. It's like 15 assignments due every class period and she's not cool about it. she acts like we are all french majors in the class.
She is an amazing French teacher I highly recommend, just do the homework and you will do fine.
